content:
Yes, several players and coaches in the Primeira Liga have tested positive for COVID-19 this season. Some of the notable cases include:

- Benfica's coach, Jorge Jesus, tested positive in mid-March 2021.
- Sporting CP's coach, Ruben Amorim, tested positive in October 2020.
- Porto's midfielder, Sergio Oliveira, tested positive in September 2020.
- Braga's striker, Ahmed Hassan, tested positive in October 2020.
- Portimonense's midfielder, Dener Clemente, died from COVID-19 in January 2021.

Many other players and staff members from different clubs have also tested positive throughout the season, leading to several games being postponed or rescheduled.
